Description: Ostracon, half a fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery grooved vessel, the interior bears the remains of five lines of black-painted demotic text, the exterior is covered with a brown slip and remains of a further six lines of black-painted demotic. The other half is EA66361.
Bibliographic references: Frankfort 1933 / The Cenotaph of Seti I at Abydos (no. 8 (p.95,pl.xciii)) (Inner side)
Wangstedt 1969 / Demotische Ostraka aus ptolemaeisch-roemischer Zeit (p. 96-97) (Inner side)
Jasnow & Pouls Wegner 2006-2007 / Demotic Ostraca from North Abydos (p. 52 no. 8.) (Inner side)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (51675) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/51675)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (no.22)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Dem. 22 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
